title: Sydney woman spots deadly blue-ringed octopus in rock pool at Balmoral Beach
text:
A mother has shared an urgent warning to parents after she found a blue-ringed octopus while swimming in a rock pool with her 17-month-old child.

Nicole Teitzel said she was at the rock pool at the northern end of Balmoral Beach, in North Sydney, with her daughter on Wednesday when they spotted the deadly sea creature.

'Pretty sure it's a blue ring octopus, zooming in there's blue rings on the dark patches,' Ms Teitzel wrote after posting images of the find.

Nicole Teitzel said she and her daughter were at a rock pool at the northern end of Balmoral Beach, in North Sydney, on Wednesday when they spotted the deadly sea creature

Other social media users confirmed that the sea creature was a deadly blue-ringed octopus

Ms Teitzel (pictured) posted the images to Facebook told others to 'keep an eye out down there, especially with little ones'

'So just a reminder to all to keep an eye out down there, especially with the little ones.'

Other social media users confirmed Ms Teitzel's worst fear - it was indeed a blue-ringed octopus.

'Definitely a blue ring [octopus],' one person commented on the post.

Another said they had previously seen a blue-ringed octopus at Balmoral Beach as well.

'Definitely be on the look out,' the wrote.

For others the creature brought up old memories.

The blue-ringed octopus bite is highly venomous to humans. Those bitten should call emergency services immediately

'Glad they haven't died out! Remember them back in the 60s,' the person commented on the social media post.

Others reiterated the danger level and were grateful for the heads up.

'You touch that and you're gone,' one person wrote.

Another said: 'Wow thanks for the warning.'
description: Nicole Teitzel said she was at the rock pool at the northern end of Balmoral Beach, in North Sydney, with her daughter on Wednesday when they spotted the deadly sea creature.
authors: Claudia Poposki For Daily Mail Australia
